column4: i installed mysql and phpmyadmin, but on pointing my browser to localhost/phpmyadmin it wants to download instad of running the php file - what to do?
You need to enable the PHP module.
says that module does not exist...?
sorry, dont really get it - where do I get the modules from? running a2enmod gives me "This module does not exist!"
ah, well, that package does not exist, apt says....running breezy, just installed it
think I found it - but: is there a problem running php5 instead of php4?
I have no experience with PHP5.
still got problems.....a2enmod php4 now says "already enabled" but still phpmyadmin wont show....got any more advice?
what i've done is to run the asenmod php4 and then restart apache2 and restart my browser -- is there any other setting or package to deal with?
